channel.title: Help with a command
channel.description: Can I make a command called "addcommand"? that would add a command, as the name suggests. example: ::addcommand home 2661 3302 or have addcommand open an interface to automatically change the needed file. Any ideas?

item.title: Help with a command
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

If you’re wishing to create a ::sethome command, that’s possible but only for a single player, it wouldn’t change everyone’s home spot to that, only the player who done it.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with a command
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

The closest you could do would be to make a command that will make ONLY specific commands and have it write to a text document.

EG: A command that will only add items to your inventory, a command that would only teleport you to a certain location, a command that would only complete one action. You could have it write to a text document, but you would have to manually add it later.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with a command
item.dc:creator: @cam_man98 cam man98
item.description:
@cam_man98 wrote:

Thanks. I know it was far fetched, but thought I might ask.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with a command
item.dc:creator: @TormentedSoul TormentedSoul
item.description:
@TormentedSoul wrote:

Probably not. Best just to have your Client.java open when you are editing things so that you can edit commands whilst playing and finding new things to add at the same time. This is what I do.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with a command
item.dc:creator: @cam_man98 cam man98
item.description:
@cam_man98 wrote:

Can I make a command called “addcommand”? that would add a command, as the name suggests.
example: ::addcommand home 2661 3302
or have addcommand open an interface to automatically change the needed file.
Any ideas?

Read full topic
